name: pre-2000 RN validator tests
description: Working and failing Belgian Rijksregisternummer (pre-2000 rule only). No BIS or special cases included; all months are 01–12 and we avoid BIS offsets (+20/+40).

testCases.because: Valid RN: 13/06/1985, seq 001 (odd), checksum uses pre-2000 rule.
Invalid length: only 10 digits (RN must be exactly 11 digits).
Invalid length: 12 digits (RN must be exactly 11 digits).
Invalid character: contains a non-digit (letters are not allowed).
Invalid date: 31/02/1999 does not exist (checksum here would otherwise fit pre-2000).
Invalid month: 13 is outside 01–12 and not a BIS offset (so it's invalid for RN).
Invalid day: 00 is not a valid calendar day for RN.
Invalid date: 29/02/1999 is not a leap day (1999 is not leap year).
Invalid day: 32 in November is not valid (and not a BIS administrative-day encoding).
Invalid sequence: 000 is not assigned for RN (even if checksum matches).
Invalid sequence: 999 is not assigned for RN (even if checksum matches).
Invalid checksum: digits base are fine but control digits are wrong for pre-2000.
Invalid month: 00 is not allowed for RN (and we are not using BIS fallbacks).
